Top frieze, part 1: grape vine; Polyxena, shown profile to the left, approaches a water fountain, on which a bird is perched; Troilus, next to his horse, followed by another bird, is behind her; a row of 6 hoplite warriors follow Troilos, all shown profile to t he left
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre

Top frieze, part 2: behind the hoplites is a man on horseback, shown profile to the left, holding a shield on his left arm and a spear in his right arm; a flying bird follows him; to the right is the beginning of a battle between lapiths and centaurs
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Top frieze, part 3: Centauromachy (battle betwen Lapiths, armed with swords, helmets, and shields, and centaurs); to the left are two centaurs throwing stones on Kaineus, to beat him into the ground
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Top frieze, part 4: Centauromachy (battle betwen Lapiths, armed with swords, helmets, and shields, and centaurs)
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Top frieze, part 5: komos, or revel (nude men dance around a krater, above which hangs a rhyton)
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Top frieze, part 6: komos, or revel (nude men dance around a krater, above which hangs a rhyton; to the right is a bearded man reaching down to an amphora, facing a man playing the double flute)
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Top frieze, part 7: the return of Hephaistos (a maenad between two satyrs, and a bull follow Hephaistos, on a donkey, as he approaches Dionysos)
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Top frieze, part 8: the return of Hephaistos (a maenad and a satyr follow Hephaistos, on a donkey, as he approaches Dionysos and Ariadne, both draped, on the right)
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Top frieze, part 9: the return of Hephaistos (two ithyphallic satyrs follow Ariadne and Dionysos to the left)
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Top frieze, part 10: the return of Hephaistos (satyrs and a goat approach from the left)
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Top frieze, part 11: the return of Hephaistos (a goat, satyrs, and a maenad mingle)
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Top frieze, part 12: symposium (bearded men recline to the right on dining couches, and reach for food on the tables in front of them; dogs eat scraps beneath them)
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre

Top frieze, part 13: symposium (bearded men recline to the right on dining couches, and reach for food on the tables in front of them, while dogs eat scraps beneath them; on the right stands a girl, profile to the left, wearing a peplos and playing the double flute)
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre

Top frieze, part 13: symposium (bearded men recline to the right on dining couches, and reach for food on the tables in front of them, while dogs eat scraps beneath them; on the left stands a girl, profile to the left, wearing a peplos and playing the double flute)
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Top frieze, part 13: symposium (bearded men recline to the right on dining couches, and reach for food on the tables in front of them, while dogs eat scraps beneath them)
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of main frieze: duel combat between two hoplite warriors; the one on the right holds a shield emblazoned with the forepart of a lion
Photograph by Maria Daniels, courtesy of the Musée du Louvre
Detail of main frieze: duel combat between two hoplite warriors; the one on the right kneels in front of his assailant, who wears an animal skin over his tunic
